title: How good is Christoph Waltz’s French in the movie Inglourious Bastards? - Quora

response.answer_text: Very. Actually I think the translators ever so slightly outdid themselves, as a kind of in-joke to the French-speaking audience. I mean, it’s a tad too perfect to be believable. If there was a “Queen’s French”, that would probably be it. But there is no Queen in France anymore. Here are (my best efforts at) direct translations for some of his lines: “I was hoping that you would invite me to enter in your house for the purpose of us having a discussion?” (Certainly. After you.)“Given that we are on a dairy farming enterprise, I suppose there is no risk of erring [by assuming] that you [people].. got milk?”“I invite you to come join me at your tabe.”“Mr LaPadite… I am in [a state of] regret to inform you that I have.. exhausted the reach of my French. To continue speaking it so little satisfactorily, would do nothing but embarrass me… Meanwhile, I do believe to know that you speak English fluidly, do you not?” (Yes.)“By chance, it just so happens that.. so do I!! … Given that we are here at your place, I demand your permission to pass onto English for the rest of the conversation…” Accent-wise.. It’s in a way flawless, but no native French speaker has that sort of intonation as far as I’m aware.
